intro: Trema lancifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved trema, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered white or yellowish flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. The fruit is a small, three-lobed capsule that disperses seeds through wind or animal activity.
